column4: I think i may have found my problem... no config file was installed... thats odd.... doesn't the package manager install that by default?
what package?
roger... having a look
i did the following command.. apt-file show conky  --> conky: /etc/conky/conky.conf
I found the error at least I was having... on the conky site it said the sample was conkyrc.sample.gz, but the actual sample file was concky.conf.gz... just, yeah... if anyone cared
hey.. roger that
any chance you might be able to help look at a script?
sorry, no. i am trying to help Brack10. and it's already past my bedtime
no prob
it means that package is being installed automatically to satisfy a dependency or a recommends
thanks!
install apt-file
when installed, then do --> apt-file search brctl
congrats :-)
